definition: close and distant, rich and poor (idiom); everyone/all possible relations
parent/one's own (flesh and blood)/relative/related/marriage/bride/close/intimate/in person/first-hand/in favor of/pro-/to kiss/(Internet slang) dear
to dredge/to clear away obstruction/thin/sparse/scanty/distant (relation)/not close/to neglect/negligent/to present a memorial to the Emperor/commentary/annotation
noble and lowly/high versus low social hierarchy of ruler to people, father to son, husband to wife in Confucianism
to be all the same way (literary)
to treat everyone equally favorably (idiom); not to discriminate between people
to grieve for the sick and the dying/to show great concern for people's suffering
desire for the public good/sense of fair play
mutual exchange of assistance (idiom)/to reciprocate with material assistance
to be looked after in life and given a proper burial thereafter (idiom)
old wrong/past grievance/wickedness of former times
